data.text: @kjoules Awesome work! How about case hospitalisation rates?
@bencowling88 @kjoules since the gov cant do much for mild cases and ppl may not want to go to isolation camps, many of them may not even report
@bencowling88 @kjoules prob the best comparison is to look at excess deaths from the same time as 2021, i am sure you will see a massive spike
@bencowling88 @kjoules at the same time , have to keep in mind of people dying with covid instead of , which is the case in denmark, which antivaxxers love to use to show vaccines dont work..........
@bencowling88 I have no doubt whatsoever CFRs for the 5th wave are rising for the exact reasons you’ve mentioned; it’s still way too early
@cmhk258 @kjoules Working on it, VE against covid death probably higher than your estimate above

@kjoules Need to account for unobserved outcomes (many cases not yet recovered). The omicron confirmed-case CFRs here are underestimated and potentially quite misleading 
Separate issue for comparability is the change in denominator - a smaller fraction of omicron infections ascertained
@ProtonJackie @kjoules They're rounding to two decimal places.  Could be 0.0049% died but that would be rounded to 0.00%

@kjoules @bencowling88  From this CHP data and the vaccine type chosen by each age group, can we estimate the VE against death for Sinovac for each age group?  Given mRNA VE is pretty well known, I think we can.  Could you give us an estimate or comment on my figures?
